patterns.description: Claims your package is held or delayed — scammers send these to millions of people hoping someone is expecting a delivery.
Requests a fee to release or redeliver a package — Canada Post, UPS, and FedEx don't collect fees via text.
Asks you to click a link to update delivery address — designed to steal your personal information.
Unsolicited tracking link for a package — verify tracking numbers directly on the carrier's official website.
Impersonates a known delivery carrier with urgent action — real carriers use their official app for notifications.

patterns.pattern: missed delivery attempt|we attempted delivery|delivery attempt failed|unable to complete delivery
patterns.description: Fake missed delivery notification — carriers leave physical notices, they don't text asking for payment.
